title: Kernel-based methods for bandit convex optimization.
abstract: We consider the adversarial convex bandit problem and we build the first  poly ( T )-time algorithm with  poly ( n ) â   T -regret for this problem. To do so we introduce three new ideas in the derivative-free optimization   literature: (i) kernel methods, (ii) a generalization of Bernoulli convolutions, and (iii) a new annealing schedule for exponential weights (with increasing learning rate). The basic version of our algorithm achieves � ( n  9.5  â   T )-regret, and we show that a simple variant of this algorithm can be run in  poly ( n  log( T ))-time per step at the cost of an additional  poly ( n )  T   o (1)  factor in the regret.
